DataElement.preferredName: Neurology Proxy Reported Epilepsy Assessment Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A branch of medicine concerned with the development, anatomy, function, and dysfunction of the nervous system._A type of advance directive that gives a person the authority to make decisions for another individual. It becomes active when that person loses the ability to make decisions for him- or herself._A short textual account; having provided a short account._A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something._The words of something written.

These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the branch of medical science that deals with the study of structure, function, and diseases of the nervous system; for thorough searching also see NEUROSCIENCE, MENTAL DISORDER, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER DIAGNOSIS, MENTAL DISORDER DIAGNOSIS, NERVOUS SYSTEM DISORDER CHEMOTHERAPY, COMMUNICATION DISORDER, NEUROMUSCULAR DISORDER.

Concepts.definition: A branch of medicine concerned with the development, anatomy, function, and dysfunction of the nervous system.

Concepts.definition: A type of advance directive that gives a person the authority to make decisions for another individual. It becomes active when that person loses the ability to make decisions for him- or herself.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.

A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions.
